intro: Phlegmariurus trifoliatus, commonly known as the three-leaf moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its three-lobed leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It plays an important role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem. Due to its delicate structure, it is sensitive to environmental changes and serves as an indicator species for habitat quality.
